data.title: [56th Armored Infantry Battalion Soldiers by Their Headquarters]
meta_keywords: Military and War - Wars - World War II
data.meta_description: Photograph of eight members of the 56th Armored Infantry Battalion standing in front of a sign for their headquarters. They are wearing dress uniforms and garrison caps and stand with their hands behind their backs. They are identified as Marvin Bright, James Withers, Edward Livaudais, J. Smith, Conrad Harness, William Hendrix, E. Smith.
data.text:
Description

Photograph of eight members of the 56th Armored Infantry Battalion standing in front of a sign for their headquarters. They are wearing dress uniforms and garrison caps and stand with their hands behind their backs. They are identified as Marvin Bright, James Withers, Edward Livaudais, J. Smith, Conrad Harness, William Hendrix, E. Smith.

Physical Description

1 photograph : b&w ; 12 x 16 cm.

Creation Information

Context

This photograph is part of the collection entitled: World War Two Collection and was provided by the 12th Armored Division Memorial Museum to The Portal to Texas History, a digital repository hosted by the UNT Libraries. It has been viewed 514 times, with 6 in the last month. More information about this photograph can be viewed below.

Creator

We've been unable to identify the creator(s) of this photograph.

Named Persons

People who are significant in some way to the content of this photograph. Additional names may appear in Subjects below.

Bright, Marvin E.

Withers, James R., Jr.

Livaudais, Edward S.

Smith, J.

Harness, Conrad P.

Hendrix, William H.

Smith, E.

Audiences

Check out our Resources for Educators Site! We've identified this photograph as a primary source within our collections. Researchers, educators, and students may find this photograph useful in their work.
